topic: 'The shirt used to weigh heavy - now England players double in size in it'
summary: World Cup winner Matt Dawson discusses England's seven-try thrashing of Wales and the lessons coach Steve Borthwick can learn from France.
transcript:
[OPENING]
Welcome listeners to Ovi English School. Today, we will talk about a sports story from England. The story is about a big win in rugby and some lessons for the coach. Here is a question for you: How many tries did England score in their game against Wales? Think about it. I will give you the answer at the end of the episode. We have a free study guide for todayâ€™s lesson. You can find the link in the description. It has vocabulary lists, exercises, and practice questions.  
[VOCABULARY]
WORD: weigh  
DEFINITION: to find out how heavy something is  
EXAMPLE: I weigh myself every morning. Can you say it? weigh. Great job!  

WORD: player  
DEFINITION: a person who plays a sport or game  
EXAMPLE: She is a good basketball player. Can you say it? player. Great job!  

WORD: double  
DEFINITION: to become two times bigger or more  
EXAMPLE: The townâ€™s population will double next year. Can you say it? double. Great job!  

WORD: learn  
DEFINITION: to get knowledge or skill from study or experience  
EXAMPLE: I learn new words every day. Can you say it? learn. Great job!  

WORD: coach  
DEFINITION: a person who teaches and trains players in sports  
EXAMPLE: The coach helps the team improve. Can you say it? coach. Great job!  

Listen for these words in todayâ€™s story!  
[NEWS STORY]
Englandâ€™s rugby team won a very big game. They played against Wales. England scored seven tries. A try is when a player touches the ball down in the other teamâ€™s area. This gives many points. Remember our word player? It means a person who plays a sport. Englandâ€™s players did very well.  

The teamâ€™s shirt used to weigh heavy. Remember our word weigh? It means to find out how heavy something is. Now, the players look like they double in size. Double means two times bigger. They are stronger and faster in the shirt.  

Matt Dawson is a famous player who won the World Cup before. He talked about the game. He said Englandâ€™s win was very good. But he also said the coach can learn from other teams. Learn means to get knowledge or skill. The coachâ€™s name is Steve Borthwick. A coach is a person who trains and helps the players.  

Matt Dawson thinks the coach can learn lessons from France. France is another strong rugby team. England can get better if they listen to these lessons. A lesson is something important we learn, often from experience.  

In rugby, teams try to score more than the other team. England scored seven tries. This is a big number. Wales did not score many points. England won by a big number. This is called a thrashing. Thrash means to defeat someone by a big difference in the score. Remember our word thrash? It means to win very easily and by a lot.  

This kind of win shows England is strong now. The players are bigger and better in their shirts. The coach has good ideas but can still learn from others. This is how sports teams grow and improve.  
[REVIEW]
Remember the word weigh? It was about the shirt that used to be heavy. Now, the players look bigger. The word player means the people who play rugby in the game. Englandâ€™s players scored many points. Double means two times bigger. The players look like they double in size in the shirt. Learn means to get new knowledge. The coach can learn lessons from other teams. The coach is the person who trains the players. A lesson is something important to learn. Thrash means to win by a big score. England gave Wales a big thrashing in the game.  
[PRACTICE]
QUESTION: How many tries did England score in the game?  
Think about your answer.  
ANSWER: England scored seven tries in the game. Did you get it right? Great job!  

QUESTION: What can the coach learn from France?  
Think about your answer.  
ANSWER: The coach can learn lessons to help the team get better. That is correct!  

QUESTION: What does the word thrash mean in the story?  
Think about your answer.  
ANSWER: Thrash means to win by a big difference in the score. Well done!  
[CLOSING]
Remember my question at the beginning? The answer is seven tries. Did you guess correctly? Today, you learned five new words: weigh, player, double, learn, and coach. You also heard about Englandâ€™s big win in rugby and how the coach can learn lessons from other teams. If you want to practice more, check the study guide. The link is in the description below. You will find vocabulary lists, exercises, and more. Thank you for learning with Ovi English School. Come back tomorrow for more English learning with real news. Every day you practice, your English gets better! Goodbye!
